newsitem.title: USA: Nalco buys Ciba pulp/paper enzyme business.
newsitem.headline: Nalco buys Ciba pulp/paper enzyme business.

text.p: Nalco Chemical Co said Thursday it acquired the pulp and paper enzyme business of Ciba Specialty Chemical Inc of Basel, Switzerland.
Terms of the agreement were not disclosed.
Nalco will receive worldwide exclusive rights to the enzyme technology which together with its polymer technology is used in paper mills during papermaking.

In addition, Nalco entered an exclusive, long-term supply and joint research agreement with Genencor International Inc, a joint venture held by Eastman Chemical Co and Cultor Ltd of Finland. Genencor is the sole supplier of these enzyme products for Ciba.
The agreement includes Nalco's exclusive right to use Genencor's pulp and paper enzyme laboratory in Finland for research and development. The lab will also provide customer support and research.
Nalco said it expects to advance the enzyme technology and expand its use to pulp and paper mill customers in the Pacific region, Europe, Latin America and North America.
Nalco Chemical provides water treatment and process chemicals and services.
